job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Computer Software,Financial Services
job.description:
Job Description
Analyze, design develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for commercial or end user applications. Writes code, completes programming and performs testing and debugging of applications.
Oracle’s Construction and Engineering Global Business Unit (CEGBU) is transforming the world by helping organizations plan, build and operate critical assets. The CEGBU serves over 155,000 customers globally ranging from small subcontractors to the largest general contracting firms and asset owners. CEGBU solutions support our customer’s ability to propose, prioritize & select strategic investments as well as control, manage and execute related projects. CEGBU solutions easily integrate with financial, human resource, supply chain, asset management and other enterprise and niche solutions. We process over 9+ billion dollars in subcontractor payments monthly, manage billions of documents & pieces of correspondence while managing over 8 billion dollars in project value. As a relatively small business unit within Oracle we strive to deliver excellent results by attracting and retaining the best people, delivering the best technology in the industry and focusing on delivering exceptional service to our customers.
Primary Position Objective
This role’s primary purpose is to work in the Site Reliability Engineering team in delivering cloud solutions that ensure customer and internal requirements are met. This will require a proven ability to deliver on time and on budget complex technical solutions in multiple roles or projects.
Previous experience working technical teams and projects at large scale is important. This is a hands-on role.
Accountability
Core Activities
Improving processes and reducing time spent on tasks
Automate internal and external processes
Continuously improve systems in order to reduce inefficiencies and maximise process capabilities
Work with both internal and external stakeholders to build accurate and thorough supportable systems
Consult with internal customers to build customer skills and understanding
Drive innovation to improve availability, capacity, performance and resilience of existing processes
Development of systems and processes
Analyse and review documentation of architecture, system relationships and systems flow to ensure effective end-to-end designs
Create and share knowledge within the organisation
Technical Project Management As Required
Managing tools like our JIRA and Git workflows according to best practices
Resolve and consult on complex technical issues
Additional Duties
As reasonably required from time to time with management
Experience, Skills And Qualifications
Required Skills, Knowledge and Experience
A smart team player with a mature mindset
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Curious, open-minded and always willing to learn
Strong skills in
Cloud and virtual computing (AWS, Azure, VMware, Oracle)
Infrastructure Coding and Development (Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Cloudformation, Terraform etc.)
Creating dashboards and monitoring tools (Grafana, ELK stack, Splunk, PagerDuty or OpsGenie)
Automation, CI/CD, DevOps concepts (Jenkins, Bamboo)
Understand Development processes (SLDC)
Analytical thinking
Technical troubleshooting and problem solving
Stakeholder management
Engaging and leading engineering teams
Experience in
Working with development teams to improve their systems and processes
Agile or similar project management methodologies
Linux systems engineering background
Scripting experience desired (PowerShell, Python, Bash or others)
Common Development languages for troubleshooting issues (Java, .Net, HTML, CSS, XML)
Network troubleshooting experience across a range of servers, operating systems and network appliances
Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience
Worked with development teams to provide support for services before they go live in production through activities such as design discussions, developing software frameworks, capacity planning and fault tolerance discussion
You tend to automate your way out of any problem and thrive on the satisfaction
Experience in monitoring systems and a deep understanding of a common monitoring system
Provided innovative and creative solutions to improve reliability of services in production
The ability to work independently and be a self-starter
Capable with collaborating with different teams to improve reliability on highly distributed and scalable platforms
Comfortable having conversations that continue to improve availability, stability and performance of the services
At Oracle, we don’t just value differences—we celebrate them. We’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people work together. We believe innovation starts with diversity and inclusion.

Analyze, design develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for commercial or end user applications. Writes code, completes programming and performs testing and debugging of applications.
As a member of the software engineering division, you will perform high-level design based on provided external specifications. Specify, design and implement minor changes to existing software architecture. Build highly complex enhancements and resolve complex bugs. Build and execute unit tests and unit plans. Review integration and regression test plans created by QA. Communicate with QA and porting engineering as necessary to discuss minor changes to product functionality and to ensure quality and consistency across specific products.
Duties and tasks are varied and complex needing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 4 years of software engineering or related experience.
If you are a Colorado resident, Please Contact us or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 118325 in the subject line of the email.
